name: Long Pearl, Blue Topaz and Moonstone Necklace by Beth Zink
description:
Strands of freshwater pearls, blue topaz and moonstone stream along the neckline in gold.  This necklace is the essential accessory for classic drama.

Southport is home to North Carolina native, Beth Zink, where she creates memorable, feminine jewelry. She artfully blends freshwater pearls and semi-precious gemstones to create simple, elegant statement pieces of jewelry. Her jewelry incorporates color with different textures and unique shapes to create pieces women enjoy wearing everyday or for special occasions. Many of Beth’s pieces are one of a kind or made in small editions and reflect her sense of classic style.

name: Multi-Row Starlight Crystalburst Necklace by Deepa Gurnani
description:
With its layers of exquisite intricacy, this necklace dazzles as a myriad of crystal stars across the sky.  Approximately 18.5" long.

While studying fashion at the prestigious Central Saint Martin’s College of Art and Design in London, Deepa Gurnani beaded couture pieces for Alexander McQueen, Emanuel Ungaro, Fendi, Marjan Pejoski, and many others. Working closely with these designers not only enabled Deepa to understand European standards of quality and finish, but also compelled her to experiment with beading and embroidery techniques on her own. This experimentation coupled with her strong background in fashion design give her the distinct sense of style and sensitivity that can be found in her own work. After moving to New York, she teamed up with fine jewelry designer Jay Lakhani, who was trained under the head designers of Tiffany and Bvlgari. The two are now married. Their collaborations make up the collections of their brand, Deepa Gurnani.

name: Chrysoprase and Green Amethyst Earrings by Zoja
description:
Green amethyst suspends like feather gemstones from spheres of chrysoprase, embodying the cultural glamour of a world traveler.  2" long.

Jewelry designer Zoja Mihic moves between the diverse and extreme environments of her home country South Africa, her second home, Paris, and her extensive travels to the East, she finds herself continuously immersed in evolving, diverse, and cosmopolitan cultures. Bringing together these collective inspirations, her jewelry expresses her contemporary approach to luxury. Zoja’s love for contrast is reflected throughout the collection with juxtaposing notes of color and texture, luxe and street- think Jewel Princess meets Street-Smart Modernist. Zoja means ‘life,’ and this energy is woven through all of her pieces. Colorful gems and and subtly toned diamonds are captured in hand-worked metals, creating precious pieces to keep for a lifetime.

He is the recipient of the CFDA’s Accessory Designer of the Year Award for 2010 and was named “Rising Star of the Year” by the Accessories council of Excellence in 2004.

name: Throat Chakra Activator Necklace with Lapis by Tailfeather Designs
description:

Though Liat of Tailfeather Designs is a native of NYC, her gypsy soul took her traveling around the world where she was deeply inspired by the different styles of jewelry she saw in the different cultures. The most precious jewelry were those given as gifts, and in that spirit Liat created Tailfeather Designs as her gift to the world. Each stone, feather, seed and metal used in the jewelry has been blessed with intention and gratitude. All materials are from sustainable sources and handmade with love.

name: Antler Tip, Gold and Sterling Silver Necklace by Melissa Joy Manning
description:
Modern meets rustic in this magnificent sterling silver necklace with its antler tip and two 14 karat gold discs.  A sought after piece, it has the presence to stand alone or to be layered with other gold and silver necklaces.  19.75" long.

Melissa Joy Manning links the modern with the traditional whenever possible. Her unique expression is clearly influenced by her passion for travel, art, and culture. She studied silversmithing and jewelry design at the Instutito de Allende in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico and European design principles at the University of Barcelona. Melissa says, “I believe in the permanence of the piece, and one of my greatest inspirations is in knowing that people will treasure their jewelry, hopefully for generations. My jewelry is not an accessory, but an expression. My pieces aren’t about buying into what mass media tells you you should be, but about finding a piece that speaks to the individuals and echoes their personality. I believe that jewelry can influence the way you feel; it can say and mean something different to every wearer.”

This one of a kind ring by Wendy Stauffer has the cognac and caramel tones that are perfect for any fall outfit. This ring is a size 7. The Montana agate is encased in a hand-made golden bezel with a brushed sterling silver ring. 

Wendy Stauffer is the creative force behind Fuss Jewelry, a limited edition collection of romantic, gem-wrapped jewelry in unique arrangements and organic themes. Fuss jewelry takes a sculptural approach to crafting flowers, vines and other natural objects with gemstones, pearls, wire and metal. Wendy’s background includes a degree in biology and a lifetime interest in design and handcrafts.  Her jewelry represents a collaboration of these interests and she enjoys combining the raw beauty of metal and stone with delicate accents and detail.

Kenda Kist jewelry is hand-crafted and designed by NC based artist, Kenda Kistemacher. Since her childhood in Muscatine Iowa, her unique collection flourished from the inspiration by found objects, crafting them into something new. Shortly after graduating from East Carolina University with a concentration in metal design, Kenda started a small signature collection. With growing popularity Kenda Kist jewelry was born. Every piece is made with delicate craftsmanship and designed to give you a classic style served up with a funky twist, timeless enough to wear at any age.

Candy Shop Vintage was founded in 2009 by designer Deirdre Zahl, whose 10 years of experience working in fashion and design in New York informed her thoughtful curation of a vintage jewelry collection. Pieces from her rotating collection of vintage jewelry have been featured in magazines, on various national blogs, and on the hit show MAD MEN.

After years of collecting and selling vintage, Zahl designed and launched The Candy Shop Collection, her own vintage inspired jewelry line that is currently sold on our website and at select retails stores. Her Collection is also sold at specialty events, including trunk shows at Bloomingdale's New York and will debuting at Henri Bendel's for four days this September. Deirdre lives in Charleston, SC, with her husband John and daughter Daphne.

description:
Claire Jacobs spent years working as a 2-D artist, focusing on printmaking and drawing, and in 2008 after attending the Penland School of Crafts she became completely fascinated by the jewelry fabrication process.  Since then, her enthusiasm for making jewelry has steadily grown with every piece of jewelry handmade with love

Claire believes we are constantly communicating with our bodies, through our gestures and the way we choose to adorn ourselves.  Claire is interested in how jewelry becomes a part of this communication when worn on the body.  Whether elegant and sleek, or tough and strong, her work is designed to empower wearers to ‘speak’ for themselves.
